010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * Enumeration of selected standard illuminants.
016 * @author WB
017 *
018 */
019public enum StandardIlluminant implements Illuminant {
020        /** Equal energy illuminant, neutral point (5400K). */
021        N       (1.0/3, 1.0/3),
022        /** D50 standard illuminant (5000K). */
023        D50     (0.9642, 1.0, 0.8249), // according to Specification ICC.1:2010 (Profile version 4.3.0.0)
024        /** D55 standard illuminant (5500K). */
025        D55 (0.33411, 0.34877), 
026        /** D65 standard illuminant used for television and sRGB color space (6500K). */
027        D65 (0.9505, 1.0, 1.0890),      // according to Specification ICC.1:2010 (Profile version 4.3.0.0), was  (0.950456, 1.0, 1.088754),
028        /** D75 standard illuminant (7500K). */
029        D75 (0.29968, 0.31740),
030        /** Incandescent tungsten (2856K). */
031        A       (0.45117, 0.40594),
032        /** Obsolete, direct sunlight at noon (4874K). */
033        B       (0.3498, 0.3527),
034        /** Obsolete, north sky daylight (6774K). */
035        C       (0.31039, 0.31905),
036        /** Cool White Fluorescent CWF (4200K). */
037        F2      (0.37928, 0.36723),
038        /** Broad-Band Daylight Fluorescent (6500K). */
039        F7      (0.31565, 0.32951),
040        /** Narrow Band White Fluorescent (4000K). */
041        F11     (0.38543, 0.37110);
042        
043        private final double X, Y, Z;
044        
045        private StandardIlluminant(double X, double Y, double Z) {
046                this.X = X; this.Y = Y; this.Z = Z;
047        }
048        
049        private StandardIlluminant(double x, double y) {
050                if (Arithmetic.isZero(y)) {
051                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illuminant y cannot be zero");
052                }
053                this.Y = 1.0;
054                this.X = x * this.Y / y;
055                this.Z = (1.0 - x - y) * this.Y / y;
056        }
057        
058        @Override
059        public double[] getXYZ() {
060                return new double[] {X, Y, Z};
061        }
062        
063}
